page.title: 03Health South of Oakley
page.content: The{doctor's surgery,}built in 1981 in Sainfoin Lane, caters for the health and well-being of 8500 people in and around Oakley. There are four{doctors {in the practice;}Borton and Eustace (men), Birtwhistle and Boucher (women) who employ: secretary, practice nurse, midwife, health visitor, 8 reception- ists and two cleaners. Surgery is open 0815 to 1930 on weekdays and 0830 to 1300 on Saturdays. Sundays are covered by a telephone answering machine. Most days 40 patients visit the surgery. Doctors visit those unable to attend. Ante-natal, Gynaecological, Slimming and Baby{Clinics}are held at the surgery. The practice has Oakley's only{dispensary.}Most common{illness:} colds and 'flu in Winter and hay fever in Summer. Stopping smoking, slimming and jogging are popular ways of trying to keep healthy.
